comment: I honestly loved Ms. Jabri she made microbiology so easy. Although we switched to in person exams because of cheating she was so caring, nice and very lenient when it came to assignments and quizzes. Definitely get to know her and utilize office hours, and after class time so she can get to know you. Easy class.

She is super sweet and caring and very knowledgable of anything micro related. She does have a accent and is soft spoken, but she can help you with any questions you have and will even walk you through the steps.

Her lab was great, she always answered our questions when we were confused about the lab and she is kind and funny. She is a bit soft spoken so make sure you are actively listening or else you will miss key details. Also please read the lab manual before class or else you will be confused.
The course is heavy, needs a lot of reading and works. Quizzes, HWs, exams, group activities. Overall, she is helpful, respond to emails fast, gives a lot of extra credits, exams are reasonable.

exams are lockdown+camera, but quizzes/homework are open note. syllabus says attendance is mandatory but she doesn't count it for points. she has group activities which she says are in person but you can do them online on d2L. ppts are 100+ slides. extra credit are offered in person , randomly during her lecture. shes not bad
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Online Savvy

comment: I was worried to take her because of the reviews, but she is so good. She helps so much. There is a pre-lab quiz every week, a midterm and a final. Lab can be difficult but she made it easy to understand and will help you endlessly. She is easy to get in contact with. If you need a good lab teacher take her or Harkins.

Professor Jabri is awesome. She is my favorite teacher so far here at Ksu. She is so kind & caring. Her test are straight forward & basically tells u what are on them. Only a midterm & final. Weekly Prelabs & in class assignments. As long as you show up and READ the lab manual, you should have no issues.
Seriously though, you have to go to lab.

Don't take if you can help it. She is so quiet you can't hear anything she says. Gives a take home lab every week and they are hard. Tests are impossible. She reads from a powerpoint downloaded from online. Only benefit is she started giving extra credit for coming to class once attendance got down to 20ish per class (in a class of 220).

She is extremely soft spoken, which in a lecture hall, did not work. Her lectures were difficult to follow. She posts the notes online and doesnt count attendance, but took off the slides that were for tests when people stopped coming. There are labs every week that are difficult to understand and are time consuming.
